summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsSustainable PackagingAvène's Tolerance Control Skin Recovery Cream is a rich, calming daily skincare for all hypersensitive, reactive, intolerant and allergic skin. Helps hydrate and restore skin's barrier in 48 hours while soothing and calming skin hyperactivity.
details: DetailsBenefitsCalms skin in 30 seconds and soothes skin discomfort, including tingling, burning sensations and tightnessProvides 24 hours of continuous hydrationIngredients are 98% of natural originSoothes and calms skin hyperreactivityKey IngredientsD-Sensinose postbiotic ingredient derived from Avène Thermal Spring Water helps calm all sensations of discomfort and restore skin's barrierItem 2586855How To UseApply to the face, neck and eye contour, morning and evening.Precautions: For external use only.IngredientsAvene Thermal Spring Water (Avene Aqua), Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Glycerin, Cetearyl Alcohol, Squalane, Cetearyl Glucoside, Cetyl Esters, Aquaphilus Dolomiae Extract Filtrate, Arginine, Beeswax (Cera Alba), Citric Acid, Tromethamine, Water (Aqua), Xanthan Gum.
how_to_use: Apply to the face, neck and eye contour, morning and evening.Precautions: For external use only.

reviews.headline: Maybe
reviews.comments: I bought this because I'm not allergic to it. However, It doesn't feel very moisturizing.

reviews.headline: Love this moisturizer!
reviews.comments: Try it out! I am sensitive and acne prone. This lotion is a must have!

reviews.headline: amazing!
reviews.comments: This cream is perfect. Gives the perfect amount of hydration, soaks into skin and doesn't clog pores. doesn't make me shiny throughout the day. it calmed my cheeks immediately and has helped with dry skin around nose/mouth. the tube is a plus and a little does go a long way.

reviews.headline: Dry, sensitive, acne prone holy grail
reviews.comments:
I have extremely sensitive skin that often reacts negatively to skincare. This is the only moisturizer I am able to continually use that actually works for my skin. I am dry and acne prone. 
I will usually develop irritations to products as I continue to use them (just some examples - La Roche Posay cleanser, Cocokind moisturizers, Clinique moisturizers, Aveeno oat cleaners, First Aid Beauty moisturizer, the list goes on with high end and drugstore products that end in irritation and sometimes acne flares). 
This cream can be Applied during my most irritated times and does not burn one bit. This is truly the only item i am extremely loyal to and recommend to EVERYONE.
This is amazing for rosacea and sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: this is my hg
reviews.comments: I almost exclusively use Avene at this point because I break out with the teeniest of fragrances. As I've gotten older, my rosacea has taken center stage. This calms it down. A tube lasts months. This lays perfectly under every makeup I use with no pilling. I don't tend to wear tons of foundation because my skin is absolutely radiant, but I can use full coverage MAC, Tarte, Dior, it all goes on flawlessly.  I layer different skincare year round but this is my always moisturizer.

reviews.headline: lessened redness and wrinkles
reviews.comments: I've tried many moisturizers and serums to fix my skin barrier after I destroyed it doing a 10 step care routine. So far, this works to make my cheeks less red without giving me acne. It also lessened a wrinkle caused by an acne scar.

reviews.headline: Thankful for this!
reviews.comments: I originally bought this product when it was on sale. I liked it well enough, but it ended up taking a backseat to my other well-loved lotions and creams. Then I got pregnant and developed cystic acne on my chin that was painful, and I couldnt get it to go away. I tried switching out my favorite Cerve nighttime cream for this Avene cream and OMG those large, deep pimples cleared up in a matter of days! I'm so thankful I had this on hand and will definitely be repurchasing.

reviews.headline: Literally amazing
reviews.comments: Worked wonders for me and all the small bumps on my skin disappeared after using this

reviews.headline: Gentle on sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this stuff and always have a bottle on hand! Its great for sensitive skin that is prone to irritation. Any time I've had skin reactions on my face, this is the product I reach for to help with the itchiness and dryness. It's very hydrating (a bit thicker) while still working well with oily skin. I especially love using this in the colder and drier winter months.

reviews.headline: Irritating and clogging
reviews.comments: I had high hopes for this product but it caused itching after applying. It also pilled and felt like it left an unpleasant film on my face. After three days I developed a few breakouts and clogged pores. It's poorly formulated.

reviews.headline: Stay away from it
reviews.comments: Too harsh on my skin

reviews.headline: This seems like a great product
reviews.comments: But unfortunately it doesn't work well for me. I haven't found a moisturizer that doesn't cause my face to turn red and feel hot to the touch

reviews.headline: Nice moisturizer
reviews.comments:
I use this as a night time moisturizer during warm weather. I started using this when I had a really bad rash and acne on my face due to over washing and high humid whether. It kept my skin moisturizered while it healed and did not cause more skin issues.
Pros: light, moisturizing, good for my sensitive skin, no smell, does the job in spring and summer months when humidity and heat is high 
Cons: too light for cold months, small amount for the amount you get and the cost but it does last for a season or so

reviews.headline: Too expensive.  Less expensive alternatives.
reviews.comments: Even with 30 per cent discount, way too expensive, especially for cost.  Many less expensive, just as effective alternatives.

reviews.headline: Calms the redness!
reviews.comments: I have rosacea.  I've been dealing with a huge flareup for the past 2 months.  Pustules, extreme redness, and a damaged moisture barrier.  I finally got the pustules gone, but the redness was still terrible along with my moisture barrier.  For whatever reason, my go to Cetaphil was not doing its job.  Read something about this Avene stuff, so I decided to give it a try.  Wow.  WOW!  Not only did it get my moisture barrier in check, it calmed the redness down CONSIDERABLY!  IDK what's in this stuff, but it's magic.  I will continue to buy!

reviews.headline: GET IT DO NOT HESITATE RUN TO THE REGISTER TO Pay itt
reviews.comments: Wow! Ive tried it all, seriously I have. My mother in law has the most precious skin shes 60 and if you see her shes Better looking than any celebrity, yes even Aniston, but she gatekeeps her skincare. One say i saw her getting an avene moisturizer out her purse. I bought it ofcourse. TODAY, three days after i bought, my friend looked at me and said "Youre skin looks so Beautiful, so soft and flawless". UMM MISS GIRL, I HAD TO RUN to give this GEM A REVIEW! Like COMMONNNN GO VIRALLLL NOWWW so they never discontinue it

reviews.headline: Amazing
reviews.comments:
I have rosacea and this is my go to product that doesn't irritate my skin!!! Absolutely love it! 
I have already finished 3 bottles!

reviews.headline: I only use this on my face.
reviews.comments: I'm prone to mila and have sensitive skin and this is my go to. I do wish it was more moisturizing but works great for sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: I'm obsessed
reviews.comments: This product is great at calming and soothing. It also helps to repair my skin barrier support and provides hydration. I like to use it as a night cream!

faceoff_positive.comments:
As a skincare enthusiast, I wanted to be thorough with my impressions of this product. I've been testing this cream for a couple of weeks and now feel confident to share my thoughts. So my general impression of this cream? Moisturizing powerhouse. I have noticed that my skin has gotten plumper and softer over the past few days, at a rapid pace, and my skin feels fantastic.

Let's start by talking about the texture. Most facial creams are lighter than this formula. Facial moisturizers usually tend to feel more gelatinous, especially the products from Korea and Japan. They tend to feel cool on the skin, which feels very satisfying. A lot of times, facial moisturizers tend to be lightly scented, and sometimes extremely scented. The Tolerance Control Cream is a very thick creamy formula, almost comparable to a hydrating body lotion. You can really feel the texture of the cream on your face, which is different from other moisturizers that are thinner and cooler on the skin. Compared to other creams I noticed my skin has been softer and plumper in a shorter period of time. The Tolerance cream is also fragrance-free, which is a feature I prefer. I like not having to smell my cream, or worry that the cream will irritate the skin. 

The only part that gives hesitation is the lack of preservatives in a product that is used in the bathroom for the face when water is often used in the bathroom and could potentially contaminate the cream with bacteria. Even natural skincare formulations include a preservative to address this issue. I feel like it might be an issue down the line.

I also did a quick look up at the product's claims. This product claims to calm the skin in 30 seconds,  provide 24 hours of moisturization, and help restore the skin barrier in 48 hours. I feel like most gentle moisturizers would also calm dry skin in 30 seconds. Based on my personal experiences, almost every moisturizer even heavily scented ones have calmed my skin in 30 seconds. Moisturizer will always reduce redness, make the skin feel less dry, and reduce irritation.  But I do think there might be some truth to the 24 hours moisturization and claims of skin barrier restoration in 48 hours. This cream is very effective at providing moisture in a short period of time, while other creams would take a week or more to notice any effects. My skin is noticeably soft and plumper than usual. It's currently summer where I live, and the weather is hot and dry on my skin. During summer my skin tends to be drier because of the sun exposure and the drying effects of constantly blasting the air conditioner. Despite this, the areas in which this cream has been applied feel soft and moisturized, while other parts of my skin are dry.

Let's move onto some of the benefits of this cream. There are a few things I like about this cream including the lack of fragrance in it. I love K-Beauty creams, but some brands can be a little overwhelming with their scents I'm talking about you Innisfree Orchid Juju Cream. 

Fragrance-free is always a great benefit. I enjoy not smelling the product and not worrying about fragrance irritating my skin. While I enjoy perfume, and I am quite a fragrance enthusiast, I prefer scentless products in my skincare line. I would rather avoid the chance of irritating my skin or dealing with scent notes that aren't to my taste. As you can tell, by the constant reviews of perfumes. The other benefit to this formula is it is also very moisturizing, which I noticed immediately. I also like the benefit of it being approved by the National Eczema Association. It means it's gentle and moisturizing enough for eczema-prone skin, which is a condition I suffer from. It seems to work as well on my Eczema as other NEA-approved creams.

So after testing this would I actually purchase this myself?

Avene's Tolerance Control Soothing Skin Recovery Cream is listed at $35 dollars. It's pricier than other creams I normally use. I usually spend between $8-15 on full-size facial moisturizers. But I have tried high moisturizers that retailed for $60. The Tolerance Control Soothing Skin Recovery Cream is definitely as equally effective as some of those luxury creams like Tatcha's. I noticed my skin felt very similar to how my skin felt while wearing Tatcha's The Dewy Skin Cream Replenishing & Plumping. The Tolerance Control Soothing Skin Recovery Cream and The Dewey Skin Cream have completely different ingredients but have similar results so it seems like a bargain buy for those who like the effects of luxury skincare. It  perked my interest when I noticed that. 

Overall I have enjoyed using this cream over the last couple of weeks. I really enjoy how effective the Tolerance Cream is at moisturizing. I would definitely recommend this cream to both those with sensitive skin and those who want the effects of luxury skincare. It's really a fantastic product. it performs similarly to Tatcha but is much more affordable. If I didn't have a bucket full of moisturizer samples, I think I would give this formula another shot.  also prefer unscented formulas when I make recommendations, and I could see family members who are nervous about too many chemicals enjoying this clean-beauty formula. It's definitely a solid product, and I'm glad for the opportunity to have tried it.
faceoff_positive.headline: Great Moisturizer, Comparable to Luxury Moisturizers

faceoff_negative.comments:
I purchased this product since they promoted it as a "replacement" for the extreme cream that they discontinued. Mind you, the extreme line products were the only moisturizers I've been able to use on my face because of struggles with rosacea and dermatitis. I was heartbroken when I saw they discontinued the line, but had high hopes for the tolerance control cream. After applying it on my face before bed, I woke up with tiny white heads and hot, blotchy skin that has yet to calm down even hours after washing and applying cold compresses. 
I really wish this company would bring back their extreme line - I know several others who had success with the extreme cream but found this new tolerance control line to be irritating. Why mess with something good? That's a surefire way to lose one-faithful customers.
faceoff_negative.headline: Horrible
